page.title: 18HOUSING 2
page.content: To continue with Tilbury ,at{The {Spindles,}next to the Football Ground, there are privately-built houses in a small estate.These were built in the early 70's and are well-designed as regard to insulation and use of space. They are rather crammed together and have tiny gardens. {Linford}has some pleasant bungalows of the 30's style, and an ever-expanding estate of private houses. These date from the mid 60's and are still being added to in 1985.They are well-designed houses; often built in terraces,but not all; and of a variety of styles. {East Tilbury}has some bungalows,a majority of post-war council houses,and a newer addition from the early 70's.{West Tilbury}has pre-war housing of patterned bricks,and some cottages -mostly modernised.
